disease_details: Common rust in corn is caused by the fungus *Puccinia sorghi*.
It typically occurs in areas with high humidity and moderate temperatures.
recommendations: Use disease-resistant corn varieties.
Ensure proper crop rotation and avoid overhead irrigation to reduce leaf wetness.

disease_details: Gray leaf spot is caused by the fungus *Cercospora zeae-maydis*.
It causes lesions on leaves that restrict the plant's ability to photosynthesize.
recommendations: Maintain proper crop rotation and residue management.
Apply fungicides during the early stages of disease development.

disease_details: Northern leaf blight is caused by the fungus *Exserohilum turcicum*.
It typically appears as long, elliptical gray-green lesions on the leaves.
recommendations: Plant resistant hybrids and practice crop rotation.
Apply fungicides if disease pressure is high.

disease_details: Early blight is caused by the fungus *Alternaria solani*.
It affects older leaves first, creating concentric rings or lesions.
recommendations: Use certified, disease-free seed potatoes and rotate crops.
Ensure good air circulation and avoid overhead irrigation.

disease_details: Late blight is caused by the pathogen *Phytophthora infestans*.
It is the disease responsible for the Irish potato famine.
recommendations: Use resistant varieties and certified disease-free seed potatoes.
Apply fungicides preventively in areas prone to late blight.

disease_details: Brown spot is caused by the fungus *Bipolaris oryzae*.
It primarily affects leaves, causing small, brownish oval spots.
recommendations: Apply balanced fertilizers, especially potassium.
Practice crop rotation and use resistant varieties.

disease_details: Rice blast is caused by the fungus *Magnaporthe oryzae*.
It affects leaves and stems, and can lead to severe yield loss.
recommendations: Use resistant rice varieties and maintain balanced soil fertility.
Apply fungicides at the first sign of the disease.

disease_details: Neck blast is caused by the fungus *Magnaporthe oryzae*, similar to leaf blast but affects the neck of the rice panicle.
It can lead to complete grain loss if untreated.
recommendations: Use resistant varieties and apply nitrogen fertilizers judiciously.
Apply fungicides at the heading stage to prevent the disease.

disease_details: Bacterial blight in sugarcane is caused by *Xanthomonas albilineans*.
It causes yellowish streaks on leaves and affects photosynthesis.
recommendations: Use disease-free planting material and plant resistant varieties.
Apply copper-based bactericides if necessary.

disease_details: Red rot is caused by the fungus *Colletotrichum falcatum*.
It affects the stalks, causing red discoloration and a sour smell.
recommendations: Plant disease-resistant varieties and avoid waterlogged conditions.
Rogue infected plants and practice crop rotation.

disease_details: Brown rust, also known as leaf rust, is caused by the fungus *Puccinia triticina*.
It affects wheat leaves and reduces grain yield and quality.
recommendations: Plant resistant wheat varieties and monitor fields regularly.
Apply fungicides at the early signs of the disease.

disease_details: Yellow rust, also known as stripe rust, is caused by the fungus *Puccinia striiformis*.
It appears as yellow pustules on wheat leaves, affecting photosynthesis.
recommendations: Grow resistant varieties and use balanced fertilizers.
Apply fungicides preventively in areas prone to rust.
